title: How to Make Dal with Al Hach (Dried Bottle Gourd) in Kashmiri Style

steps.headline: Clean and wash mixed pulses.
Add water.
Keep the utensil on the gas stove or the induction stove to  cook it.
Boil till the pulses are well cooked.
Place the Al Hach in a utensil.
Add warm water to it.
Keep it for an hour.
Smash the al hach with finger tips so that dirt is removed.
Discard the dirty water and add warm water more into it.
Rub once with the finger tips and let al hach soak for some more time in water.
Add oil in a frying pan and add crushed black cardamom.
Add cumin seeds and sauté them.
Add chopped onions and sauté them for 5 to 10 minutes.
Add chopped tomatoes and mix them.
Cook till the time juices are seen in the pan.
Add salt.
Mix them.
Add green chilies.
Add ginger garlic paste and asafoetida powder and mix well.
Add turmeric powder.
Add coriander powder.
Mix well and fry them for 5 minutes.
Add the prepared gravy into the dal.
Mix them.
Pick handful of soaked al hach and add them to the pulses.
Add kashmiri red chili powder.
Mix them and cook for 10 minutes.
Add lemon juice.
Garnish with the chopped Coriander leaves.
Serve it with rice.

text: Clean and wash mixed pulses.  Add water.  Keep the utensil on the gas stove or the induction stove to  cook it.  Boil till the pulses are well cooked.  Place the Al Hach in a utensil.  Add warm water to it.  Keep it for an hour.  Smash the al hach with finger tips so that dirt is removed.  Discard the dirty water and add warm water more into it.  Rub once with the finger tips and let al hach soak for some more time in water.  Add oil in a frying pan and add crushed black cardamom.  Add cumin seeds and sauté them.  Add chopped onions and sauté them for 5 to 10 minutes.  Add chopped tomatoes and mix them.  Cook till the time juices are seen in the pan.  Add salt.  Mix them.  Add green chilies.  Add ginger garlic paste and asafoetida powder and mix well.  Add turmeric powder.  Add coriander powder.  Mix well and fry them for 5 minutes.  Add the prepared gravy into the dal.  Mix them.  Pick handful of soaked al hach and add them to the pulses.  Add kashmiri red chili powder.  Mix them and cook for 10 minutes.  Add lemon juice.  Garnish with the chopped Coriander leaves.  Serve it with rice.
